ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for REST APIs

code.description: the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

details.description: The optional details of the error response.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists. This needs to be
flexible so we can support multiple formats

internal.description: Internal error code in cases where we don't have an array of errors

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request

type.description:
URI pointing at a document that describes the error and mitigation steps
If there is no document, point to the RFC for the HTTP error code

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.oam.v1alpha1.Mirror.description: Mirror is the Schema for the mirrors API

spec.description: Mirror allows for the configuration of mirroring sources, including interfaces, subinterfaces, and filters, as well as the destination for the mirrored traffic, which can be either local or remote.

localDestination.description: Local destination for the mirror, there can only be either a remote destination or local destination provisioned for a Mirror.

interface.description: Reference to an Interface resource to send the mirrored traffic to.  This must be on the same Node as the source.
interface.title: Local Interface

vlanID.description: Single value between 0-4094 support, or the special keyword untagged.
vlanID.title: VLAN ID

localDestination.title: Local Destination

remoteDestination.description: Remote destination for the mirror, there can only be either a remote destination or local destination provisioned for a Mirror.

defaultRouter.description: Specifies the DefaultRouter to reach the remote destination of the mirror, a Router and DefaultRouter reference cannot be set at the same time.
defaultRouter.title: Default Router

destinationIP.description: Remote destination IP address.  When a remote destination is used for the mirror, the destinationIP is mandatory.
destinationIP.title: Destination IP

router.description: Specifies the Router to reach the remote destination of the mirror, a Router and DefaultRouter reference cannot be set at the same time.
router.title: Router

sourceIP.description: Source IP to use when sending a mirror to a remote destination.  When a remote destination us used for the mirror, the sourceIP is mandatory.
sourceIP.title: Source IP

remoteDestination.title: Remote Destination

ui-conditions.condition: (spec.remoteDestination.router === undefined && spec.remoteDestination.defaultRouter !== undefined) || (spec.remoteDestination.router !== undefined && spec.remoteDestination.defaultRouter === undefined)
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Default Router and Router cannot both be configured at the same time

direction.description: The direction of the traffic being mirrored.
direction.title: Direction

filter.description: Emittes an MirrorFilter and uses the filter as a source for the Mirror.

entries.description: Specifies the list of filter entries, in order.

action.description: An action to take, either 'accept', or 'drop'.
action.title: Action

destinationPortName.description: Destination port to match by name.
destinationPortName.title: Destination Port Name

destinationPortNumber.description: Destination port to match by numerical value.
destinationPortNumber.title: Destination Port Number

destinationPortOperator.description: Operator to use when matching destinationPort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
destinationPortOperator.title: Destination Port Operator

destinationPortRange.description: Range of destination ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200,  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
destinationPortRange.title: Destination Port Range

icmpCode.description: Match a specific ICMP code, as a number between 0-255, e.g. 0.
icmpCode.title: ICMP Code

icmpTypeName.description: Match a specific ICMP type by name, e.g. dest-unreachable.
icmpTypeName.title: ICMP Type Name

icmpTypeNumber.description: Match a specific ICMP type by number.
icmpTypeNumber.title: ICMP Type Number

protocolName.description: Match a specific IP protocol name (specified in the type field of the IP header).
protocolName.title: Protocol Name

ui-defaults.condition: !ipEntry.protocolName && ((ipEntry.sourcePortNumber || ipEntry.sourcePortRange !== '' || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== '' || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== '' || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== '') || ipEntry.tcpFlags !== '')

protocolNumber.description: Match a specific IP protocol number (specified in the type field of the IP header).
protocolNumber.title: Protocol Number

rateLimit.description: Rate limit to apply when the action is 'RateLimit'.

burstSize.description: The maximum burst size in bytes.
burstSize.title: Burst Size

entrySpecificPolicer.description: Controls policer instantiation: false for shared instance, true for per-entry instances
entrySpecificPolicer.title: Entry Specific Policer

peakRate.description: The peak rate in kilobytes per second.
peakRate.title: Peak Rate

scope.description: Determines how the policer is applied across subinterfaces. Global applies the policer across all subinterfaces, while Subinterface applies it individually to each subinterface.
scope.title: Scope

rateLimit.title: Rate Limit

sourcePortName.description: Source port to match by name.
sourcePortName.title: Source Port Name

sourcePortNumber.description: Source port to match by numerical value.
sourcePortNumber.title: Source Port Number

sourcePortOperator.description: Operator to use when matching sourcePort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
sourcePortOperator.title: Source Port Operator

sourcePortRange.description: Range of source ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200.  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
sourcePortRange.title: Source Port Range

tcpFlags.description: Match TCP flags, usable with !, &, | and the flags RST, SYN, and ACK.
tcpFlags.title: TCP Flags

ui-conditions.condition: !((ipEntry.action === undefined) && (ipEntry.sourcePortNumber !== null || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber !== null || ipEntry.sourcePrefix !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPrefix !== undefined || ipEntry.soucePortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortOperator !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortOperator !== undefined || ipEntry.protocolNumber !== null || ipEntry.protocolName !== undefined || ipEntry.icmpTypeName !== undefined || ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber !== null || ipEntry.tcpFlags !== undefined || ipEntry.firstFragment !== false || ipEntry.fragment !== false))
ui-conditions.errorMsg: An IP action must be set if any of the IP fields are set.
Fragment match must be enabled when First Fragment match is enabled.
Only one of Source Port Number, Source Port Range or Source Port Name can be set at a time.
Only one of Destination Port Number, Destination Port Range or Destination Port Name can be set at a time.
Only one of the Protocol Number or Protocol Name can be set at a time.

ui-conditions.condition: (ipEntry.icmpTypeName === undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber === null) || (ipEntry.icmpTypeName !== undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber === null) || (ipEntry.icmpTypeName === undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber !== null)
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Either ICMP Type Name or ICMP Type Number must be set, but not both.

entries.title: Entries

filter.title: Filter

subinterfaces.description: Subinterfaces on which to deploy the IPFilter to use as a source for the Mirror.

bridgeInterfaces.description: List of BridgeInterfaces, all traffic from all BridgeInterfaces in the list will be used as sources to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
bridgeInterfaces.title: Bridge Interfaces

subinterfaces.description: List of Interfaces and subinterface indices

index.description: Index of the sub-interface. This is ignored on a node running SROS.
index.title: Subinterface Index

interfaceName.description: Reference to an Interface resource, the combination of the Interface and the specified subinterface index will build the subinterface to be used as a source of traffic to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
interfaceName.title: Interface Name

vlan.description: Reference to the VLAN resource under which the sub-interface is configured. This is mandatory when the sub-interface is on a node running SROS and ignored for all other node operating systems.
vlan.title: VLAN

subinterfaces.title: Subinterfaces

vlans.description: List of VLAN resources, all subinterfaces attached to the VLAN will be used as sources to be mirrored.  A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
vlans.title: VLAN

subinterfaces.title: Subinterfaces

interfaces.description: Reference to an Interface resource to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.

interfaceSelector.description: Select Interfaces using a label selector to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.  If both a label selector is used and a list of Interfaces is provided, a combination of all selected and provided interfaces will be mirrored.
interfaceSelector.title: Interface Selector

interfaces.description: List of Interfaces to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.  If both a label selector is used and a list of Interfaces is provided, a combination of all selected and provided interfaces will be mirrored.
interfaces.title: Interfaces
Interfaces

bridgeInterfaces.description: List of BridgeInterfaces, all traffic from all BridgeInterfaces in the list will be used as sources to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
bridgeInterfaces.title: Bridge Interfaces

subinterfaces.description: List of Interfaces and subinterface indices

index.description: Index of the sub-interface. This is ignored on a node running SROS.
index.title: Subinterface Index

interfaceName.description: Reference to an Interface resource, the combination of the Interface and the specified subinterface index will build the subinterface to be used as a source of traffic to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
interfaceName.title: Interface Name

vlan.description: Reference to the VLAN resource under which the sub-interface is configured. This is mandatory when the sub-interface is on a node running SROS and ignored for all other node operating systems.
vlan.title: VLAN

subinterfaces.title: Subinterfaces

vlans.description: List of VLAN resources, all subinterfaces attached to the VLAN will be used as sources to be mirrored.  A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
vlans.title: VLAN

spec.title: Specification

ui-conditions.condition: (spec.localDestination.interface === undefined && spec.remoteDestination.destinationIP !== undefined) || (spec.localDestination.interface !== undefined && spec.remoteDestination.destinationIP === undefined)
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Either Local Destination or Remote Destination must be configured, but not both.

ui-conditions.condition: (spec.remoteDestination.destinationIP !== undefined && spec.remoteDestination.sourceIP !== undefined) || (spec.remoteDestination.destinationIP === undefined && spec.remoteDestination.sourceIP === undefined)
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Both Destination IP and Source IP must be configured together or left unset.
When both Destination IP and Source IP are set, either Router or Default Router must be set, but not both.

status.description: MirrorStatus defines the observed state of Mirror

lastChange.description: Indicates when this SubInterface last changed state.
lastChange.title: Last Change

mirrorID.description: Mirror Identifier used as the name of the mirror.
mirrorID.title: MirrorID

numActiveInterfaces.description: Total number of active Interfaces used as sources of the mirror.
numActiveInterfaces.title: Number of Active Interfaces

numActiveSubinterfaces.description: Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror.
numActiveSubinterfaces.title: Number of Active Subinterfaces

numActiveV4FilterSubinterfaces.description: Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV4Filter associations.
numActiveV4FilterSubinterfaces.title: Number of Active V4 Filter Subinterfaces

numActiveV6FilterSubinterfaces.description: Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV6Filter associations.
numActiveV6FilterSubinterfaces.title: Number of Active V6 Filter Subinterfaces

numActiveVLANSubinterfaces.description: Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from VLAN resource references.
numActiveVLANSubinterfaces.title: Number of Active VLAN Subinterfaces

numberActiveBridgeInterfaces.description: Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from BridgeInterface resource references.
numberActiveBridgeInterfaces.title: Number of Active Bridge Interfaces

operationalState.description: Indicates the current operational state of the Mirror instance.
operationalState.title: Operational State

subinterfaces.description: List of members in this Interface.

configuredSource.description: Indicates what is driving the particular subinterface to be selected as a mirror source.
configuredSource.title: Configured Source

subinterfaceIndex.description: Index allocated to the subinterface which is being mirrored. If an interface is used as a source, this will not be set.
subinterfaceIndex.title: Subinterface Index

subinterfaces.title: Subinterfaces

status.title: Status
